name: Finnish Information Security Cluster, FISC ry
membership: member of North Euroepan Cybersecurity Cluster NECC and European Cybersecurity Organization ECSO
goal: Finnish Information Security Cluster is an organization established in 2012 by major Finnish information security companies to promote their business and operations in national and international context. We believe that cyber security involves everyone. It requires extensive public-private-partnership cooperation models
interests: Borders and Security, Budget, Business and Industry, Communication, Competition, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Foreign affairs and security policy, Fraud prevention, Trade, Trans-European Networks
euInitiatives: Global Trade, Privacy, IPR, internal cybersecurity legislation, standardization, cybersecurity, safety and IT
